# Erdős #368 - Largest Prime Factor of n(n+1)

## Problem Statement

Let F(n) be the largest prime factor of n(n+1). How large must F(n) be?

## Status

**Erdős Database Status**: PARTIALLY SOLVED

**Formalization**: 478 lines

## Timeline of Lower Bounds

| Year | Result | Bound |
|------|--------|-------|
| 1918 | Pólya | F(n) → ∞ |
| 1935 | Mahler | F(n) ≫ log log n |
| 2024 | Pasten | F(n) ≫ (log log n)²/(log log log n) |
| Conj | Erdős | F(n) ≫ (log n)² |

## Concrete Values
